Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with handle root; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: from top, maeander pattern running right above band of zigzags; in handle zone, part of black handle root and handle frill pattern; at right, on cul, dotted concentric circles; below, wide and narrow bands above frieze of broken maeander.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 31)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43, note 96; p. 70; p. 234, no. 133, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0166) (phase 2)
